definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Gorbachev called for decollectivization from above; China’s farmers decollectivized spontaneously from below.
sentences.chinese: 而中国农民去集体化是从底层自发的。

sentences.english: After that we can talk of collectivization.
sentences.chinese: 到那以后，才能谈集体化。

sentences.english: In 1928, forced collectivization of farms was initiated.
sentences.chinese: 在1928年，强迫农场集体化开始了。

sentences.english: In 1953, Chinese agriculture took the path of collective farming.
sentences.chinese: 1953年，中国的农业走上了集体化的道路。

sentences.english: There have been two great leaps forward in the development of Marxist agricultural collectivist thought.
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义农业集体化思想发展有两次飞跃。

definition: collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)
fixing of farm output quotas for each household
to nationalize/to take over as communal property
rural household contract responsibility system, PRC government policy linking rural income to productivity
pinyin: nong2 cun1 jia1 ting2 lian2 chan3 cheng2 bao1 ze2 ren4 zhi4
related.word: 农村家庭联产承包责任制

definition: land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
